page.title: 06Industry in the area
page.content: All sectors of industry are found in the area.{Primary}activities are largely extractive, particularly of coal (a washing and screening plant in Skelmanthorpe), clay (Naylors pipe works) and building stone. (Houses of sandstone still popular, if less so, despite the advent of artificial materials.){Secondary}activities are dominated by the textile industry, now much slimmed down and often with foreign backing - artificial fibres much in evidence - producing a more limited range of goods. Field Rugs and Shelley Textiles are good examples of the new textile industry. Some old mill premises have been converted to small scale units providing service industry such as car repairing. The{ {tertiary}sector has seen some growth in leisure activities(eg social clubs) and home-based professional firms.
